Description: Fragment from a ring-shaped pottery sanctuary lamp with about thirty-six nozzles: traces of three wick-holes. Fine orange-red fabric with very fine mica and white inclusions. Burnt in places.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Dr Ernest Arthur Gardner
Curator's comments: Several lamps of this type have been found in the Temenos of Aphrodite (Gardner 1888, 48; British Museum GR 1888,0601.151.a-c; 1888,0601.151.d-e; 1888,0601.151.f; 1888,0601.151.g; 1965,0930.884-885). Parallel from Athens (Howland 1958, Type 143), the sanctuary of Hemithea at Kastabos (Cook and Plommer 1966, 55-6, pl. 9) and the sanctuary of Demeter, Knossos (Coldstream 1973, pls 13, 15 and 26). Howland, R.H. 1958. The Athenian Agora, IV, Greek lamps and their survivals. Princeton. Cook, J. M. and Plommer, W. H. 1966. The Sanctuary of Hemithea at Kastabos, Cambridge. Coldstream, J. N. 1973. Knossos, the Sanctuary of Demeter, London.
Bibliographic references: Lamp / Catalogue of the Lamps in the British Museum (Q152.c)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (KA.17) (Phase 1)
